text: When your mind dwells on the senses, attachment arises. From attachment comes desire.
You have the right to work, but for the work's sake only.
The soul is neither born, nor does it ever die.
Yoga is the journey of the self, through the self, to the self.
A person can rise through the efforts of their own mind.
There is nothing lost or wasted in this life.
Set thy heart upon thy work, but never on its reward.
He who has no attachments can really love others, for his love is pure and divine.
The mind acts like an enemy for those who do not control it.
Whatever happened, happened for the good. Whatever is happening, is happening for the good.
When meditation is mastered, the mind is unwavering like the flame of a candle in a windless place.
The wise see that there is action in the midst of inaction and inaction in the midst of action.
Seek refuge in the attitude of detachment and you will amass the wealth of spiritual awareness.
The self-controlled soul, who moves amongst sense objects, free from attachment and aversion, attains peace.
